page.title: 05A Dairy Farm Near Churcham.
page.content: The house itself was built in three parts.One part is four hundred and fifty years old,the back is three hundred and fifty years old,the front is one hundred and fifty years old.Some people think that the house is haunted.The house has belonged to the Tucker family since 1912. Churcham House has five farm buildings and sixty hectares of land.The crops grown are grass,peas and barley.The farmer uses nitrogen fertilizer on the land. There are a hundred cattle;eighty of which are cows.There is a Hereford bull and the calves are a cross between Hereford and Friesian.The A.I man comes at mating time.After calving the cows are sent to the abattoir.The cows are milked for nine months.The milk is sent to Northern Dairies.
